subComponents.description: Deep and shallow convection is Betts_1986. Details of PBL turbulence and large scale condensation can be found in Alekseev_1998.

Cloud amount is calculated diagnostically using relative humidity, temperature and vertical temperature gradient. Cloud overlap is maximum within each of 3 cloud layers (high, medium, low), but overlap of clouds between 3 cloud layers is random. Details can be found in Alekssev_1998. Present cloud amount calculation is slightly different from Alekseev_1998, but basic order remains the same.

subComponents.description: Spatial difference scheme for U, V, T is constructed according to Arakawa_1977

values: Mean humidity and heat is conserved
Zero heat flux at the upper boundary
Zero momentum flux at the upper boundary
Second order in space and time
Laplas **4 for U, V, T, Q

subComponents.description: Orographic GWD is considered according to Palmer_1986. Non-orographic GWD is included according to Hines_1997. No convective gravity waves.

subComponents.description:
Details of atmospheric radiation see in Alekseev_1998, Galin_1998
In radiation, additional artificial "zero" level appears above the uppermost model level. Therefore, for radiation fluxes we have 23 levels, while in atmospheric dynamics there are 21 levels only.

values: Optical thickness scenario dependent on latitude and month was recommended for CMIP3

subComponents.description: see Alekseev_1998 for details

properties.description: Land ice albedo is function of temperature, see Alekseev_1998.

subComponents.description: Snow free albedo is prescribes for 4 seasons. Snow albedo is calculated using surface temperature and vegetation type.
Soil and vegetation carbon are calculated according to LSM1.0 (Bonan_1996). Carbon cycle in INM model is described in Volodin_2007.
Vegetation carbon cycle is parametrized according to Bonan_1996, but with calculated LAI rather than prescribed. Climate model with carbon cycle is described in Volodin_2007.

subComponents.description: Surface temperature and surface sensible and latent heat flux are calculated for 4 surface land types: bare soil, vegetation, snow cover, inland water. Ther is no subsurface tiling. Evaporation is formulated in terms of relative humidity for bare soil (alpha) and in terms of resistance for vegetation (beta). See details in Alekseev_1998.

citations.title: Alekseev_1998
citations.collectiveTitle: Alekseev, V.A., E.M. Volodin, V.Ya. Galin, V.P. Dymnikov, and V.N. Lykossov (1998). "Modeling of the present-day climate by the atmospheric model of INM RAS DNM GCM. Description of the model version A5421 and results of AMIP2 simulations". INM Report N2086-B98. Available by request from volodin@inm.ras.ru

subComponents.description: In lakes that are explicitely resolved by oceanic model (1x0.5 degrees in longitude and latitude) 3-dimensional model similar to oceanic model is worked. Unresolved lakes are parameterized as fraction of gridcell covered by very thin water layer (in the case of surface temperature above 0C)

River runoff calculated in river basin gridpoint is summarized and moves to river mouth instantaneousely, where it influences on oceanic dynamics. Evaporation from inland water (subgrid-scale lakes, wetlands, irrigation land) treated as negative river runoff.
See details in Alekseev_1998

citations.title: Alekseev_1998

Description of the model version A5421 and results of AMIP2 simulations". INM Report N2086-B98. Available by request from volodin@inm.ras.ru

subComponents.description: All soil is divided into 11 types according to percent of sand, clay and organics. Coefficients for thermal and water conductivity, water table, and some other constants are prescribed for 11 soil types, see Alekseev_1998, Volodin_1998.
Heat diffusion is considered in snow (3 leyers) and soil (23 layers) includion freezing/melting according to Alekseev_1998, Volodin_1998.

subComponents.description: Potential vegetation is prescribed (fixed) according to Wilson_1985. Actual vegetation is calculated using potential vegetation, available water in root zone and soil temperature. Details are in Alekseev_1998.

properties.description: Details of land surface scheme can be seen in Volodin_1998 or Alekseev_1998. Coupling with the atmosphere is done using iterations.

subComponents.description: See details in Volodin_etal_2010, Marchuk_etal_2010.
See Marchuk_etal_2010

citations.collectiveTitle: Marchuk, G.I., V.B. Zalesny, V.I. Agoshkov, A.V. Bagno, A.V. Gusev, N.A. Diansky, S.N. Moshonkin, R.Tamsalu, and E.M. Volodin (2010). "Numerical simulation of large-scale ocean circulation based on multicomponent splitting method". Russian Journal of Numerical Analysis and Mathematical Modeling, 25, 581-609.
citations.title: Marchuk_etal_2010

subComponents.description:
Isopycnal diffusion with constant coefficient and Laplas**2 at sigma-surfaces are applied for temperature and salinity. 
Laplas**2 and Laplas**4 at sigma-surfaces with constant coefficients are applied for u, v.
Laplas**2 at model sigma-surfaces with constant coefficient 8e+13 m4/s as well as Laplas**4 at model sigma-surfaces with constant coefficient 1.2e+27 m8/s are applied for momentum
Isopycnal diffusion with constant coefficient of 8e+2 m2/s, and Laplas**2 at model sigma-surfaces with constant coefficient of 8e+13m4/s are applied for temperature and salinity.
No specific treatment of bottom boundary layer, bottom friction only.

citations.collectiveTitle: Marchuk, G.I., V.B. Zalesny, V.I. Agoshkov, A.V. Bagno, A.V. Gusev, N.A. Diansky, S.N. Moshonkin, R.Tamsalu, and E.M. Volodin (2010). "Numerical simulation of large-scale ocean circulation based on multicomponent splitting method". Russian Journal of Numerical Analysis and Mathematical Modeling, 25, 581-609.
citations.title: Marchuk_etal_2010

subComponents.description: See Marchuk_etal_2010.
Mixed layer is paramererized by vertical diffusion (Philander-Pakanowsky), but with additional mixing induced by wind waves. Maximum coefficient is 5e-2 m2/s for tracers and momentum.

properties.description:
Fortran function for equation of state: 
 
C SEA WATER DENSITY DEVIATION FROM 1.02 [GR/CM**3]
C AS FUNCTION OF T[C](potential),S[PPT],P[MPa]
C By Bryden et al.:"A new approximation of the equation of state for
C                   seawater, suitable for numerical ocean models."
C In: J.Geophis.Res.,v.104,No.C1, p.1537-1540, 1999.

       REAL      PRESTOMPA,T,S,P,DENP
       PARAMETER(PRESTOMPA=1.0E-07)

      DENP(T,S,P) =-2.00920601E-02
C    1 + (             5.07043E-04*P-5.43283E-07*P*P)
     2 + ( 5.10768E-05-3.69119E-06*P+6.54837E-09*P*P)*T
     3 + ( 8.05999E-04-9.34012E-07*P+1.38777E-09*P*P)*S
     4 + (-7.40849E-06+5.33243E-08*P-1.01563E-10*P*P)*T*T
     5 + (-3.01036E-06+1.75145E-08*P-2.34892E-11*P*P)*T*S
     6 + ( 3.32267E-08-3.25887E-10*P+4.98612E-13*P*P)*T*T*T
     7 + ( 3.21931E-08-1.65849E-10*P+2.17612E-13*P*P)*T*T*S

Time scheme for temperature and salinity is Matsuno scheme:
X(n+1*)=X(n)+F(X(n))
X(n+1)=X(n)+F(X(n+1*))
Time scheme for momentun is semiimplicit. See Marchuk_etal_2010 for details.

values: TF=-0.0575*S, where TF - freezing point (C), and S - salinity (promille)
River runoff comes to uppermost model layer without any additional mixing
2 hours for barotropic solver and momentum, 20 minutes for temperature and salinity

subComponents.description: Ocean BioGeoChemistry is very simple and contains advection of total carbon amount by oceanic currents, CO2 exchange at the ocean-atmosphere surface and simple parameterization of biological pump that takes carbon in the uppermost 100m and returns it in near-bottom layers. The strength of biological pump is prescribed and not depends on space and time. See details in Volodin_2007.
Exchange of CO2 is taken into account only. Ocean-atmosphere flux is calculated using bulk-formulae, in the same manner as heat or moisture flux. See details in Volodin_2007.

subProperties.description: There is no explicit biology in the model. Transport of total carbon amount only

values: Total carbon amount is calculated only, no other biogeochemistry

subComponents.description: See details of ice dynamics and thermodynamics in Iakovlev_2008.
Advection using MPDATA with upwind finite difference first order scheme (Iakovlev_2008).

values: No ice strength, the only sea ice cathegory is considered
Area change calculates in assumption that new ice thickness is 0.05m
Thermal properties depending on S-T (fixed salinity)

citations.title: Iakovlev_2008

values: Ice area, ice mass, snow mass, U, V, x-component of stress tensor, y-component of stress tensor, xy-component of stress tensor
4 min for dynamics, 2 hours for thermodynamics
